abstract_summ: The crossover time point with the subsequent increasing recovery rate can be a strategy for lockdown relaxation as evident from the experiences of few countries.Hence, the French lockdown prevented 587,730 hospitalizations and 140,320 ICU admissions at the national level.However, these measures cannot last forever; therefore, many countries are already considering relaxing the lockdown measures.The former would likely be very serious in the UK, would halt the decline in numbers in most countries and could lead to second peaks in some countries.We studied epidemiological parameters for 18 countries and obtained crossover time point referring to cumulative case active and case recovery rates and the time point for the peak positive confirmation rate in a time window of 92 days; and linked with the respective governmental decisions.
title_summ: A Global Observation of SARS Cov-2 ManagementCOVID-19 lockdown: if, when and howRapid assessment of the impact of lockdown on the COVID-19 epidemic in PortugalExpected impact of lockdown in Île-de-France and possible exit strategiesHasty Reduction of COVID-19 Lockdown Measures Leads to the Second Wave of InfectionOn Fast Multi-Shot COVID-19 Interventions for Post Lock-Down MitigationEvaluation of the lockdowns for the SARS-CoV-2 epidemic in Italy and Spain after one month follow upImpact of complete lockdown on total infection and death rates: A hierarchical cluster analysisEuropean lockdowns and the consequences of relaxation during the COVID-19 pandemicCOVID-19: One-month impact of the French lockdown on the epidemic burdenForecast of the COVID-19 outbreak, collapse of medical facilities, and lockdown effects in Tokyo,JapanCumulative Active and Recovery Rates Based Criterion for Gradual Lockdown Exit:
title_abstract_phrases: The crossover time point with the subsequent increasing recovery rate can be a strategy for lockdown relaxation as evident from the experiences of few countries.COVID-19: One-month impact of the French lockdown on the epidemic burdenOn March 16 2020, French authorities ordered a large scale lockdown to counter the COVID-19 epidemic wave rising in the country, stopping non-essential economic, educational, and entertainment activities, maintaining mainly food retailers and healthcare institutions.COVID-19 lockdown: if, when and howBackground: With the lack of an effective SARS-CoV-2 vaccine, mathematical modeling has stepped up in the COVID-19 management to guide non-pharmaceutical intervention (NPI) policies.We studied epidemiological parameters for 18 countries and obtained crossover time point referring to cumulative case active and case recovery rates and the time point for the peak positive confirmation rate in a time window of 92 days; and linked with the respective governmental decisions.These countries enforced strict lockdown regulations and have shown constant improvement in their recovery rate even after crossover time point.
